text: Ren Xiong's self-portrait Ren Xiong (; July 19, 1823 – November 23, 1857) was a Chinese painter from Xiaoshan, Zhejiang, active during the late Qing dynasty. Ren belonged to the Shanghai School in Chinese painting and is known for his bold and innovative style. His brother was the painter Ren Xun. According to the scholar Meccarelli, the particular definition of pictorial naturalism, might result from contacts established with the art of photography, rather than a “simple” assimilation of Western painting techniques and models.Meccarelli M., Foo Y., Flamminii A. and the West in the Art of the Nineteenth Century: A Cultural and Historical Review of the Relations between Painting and Photography" Ming Qing Studies 2013, pp. 117-160 ==Paintings== File:Mjmhg009-renxiong.jpg|After the poems of Da Mei File:Ren xiong 1.jpg|(title not known) File:Ren Xiong - The Goddess of the Luo River.jpg|The Goddess of the Luo River ==References== ==Further reading== * ==External links== *Innovations in Chinese Painting (1850 - 1950) Category:1823 births Category:1857 deaths Category:Artists from Hangzhou Category:Qing dynasty painters Category:19th-century Chinese painters Category:Painters from Zhejiang
